repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: what list missing preview relate flags.

Soltion: add preview_winid and preview_bufnr in coplete_info what list

comment_data.body: Why do we need both of these fields? The buffer shown by `preview_winid` is implicitly the "preview bufnr".

What is the actual use-case for this field? The docs are unclear. Is it for showing info about the selected item? Then it should be named something like `info_winid`.

The name `preview_winid` only makes sense if it's coupled to the the `:help preview-window` concept.
yes .. It is just a convenience. users do not need nvim_win_get_buf or winbufnr

Explain how it works now When the `info` of `complete-item` is set and `cot+=popup` We use a floating window here `(preview_winid, preview_bufnr)`, these two fields can be obtained in `complete_info()` with `ComplateChanged`, the main purpose is to set the filetype of buffer. lsp usually returns markdown or plaintext. 

The second is that lsp supports [completionitem_resolve request](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#completionItem_resolve). Info may be obtained through a second request. Call nvim__complete_set in the asynchronous request callback of lsp to create a floating for the selected item and display info. eg

```lua
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('CompleteChanged', {
     callback = function()
                  -- it's better use a debounce timer here
                  local data = vim.fn.complete_info({'selected'})
                  client:requiest('completionitem_resolve', complete_item, function(err, result,...)
                            vim.api.nvim__complete_set(data.selected, {info = result })
                   end, bufnr) 
     end
})
```

Problems noticed. The first selected field of nvim__complete_set_info may be a bit redundant. This should be controlled by the user. Because if C-N/C-P is frequent, a timer is needed here for anti-shake. So the user should know clearly whether the currently selected item and the item before sending the request are the same item when calling nvim_complete_set_info. We do not need this selected parameter for verification.

```lua
                  local data = vim.fn.complete_info({'selected'})
                  client:requiest('completionitem_resolve', complete_item, function(err, result,...)
                           local curdata =  vim.fn.complete_info({'selected'})
                            if curdata.selected ~= data.selected then return end
                           -- a bit redundant ???????????????
                            vim.api.nvim__complete_set(curdata.selected, {info = result })
                   end, bufnr) 
 ````

Let's drop it for now. That is not a very strong use-case for increasing surface area here.

Keeping the surface-area minimal will help us focus on the important parts of this interface (which we are still figuring out).

> When the `info` of `complete-item` is set and `cot+=popup` We use a floating window here `(preview_winid, preview_bufnr)`, these two fields can be obtained in `complete_info()`

So is `info_winid` a good name for the field?
Yes. This needs to be distinguished from the legacy preview.  just describes the how current works since you missed that PR
if we want drop the `nvim__complete_set` also need remove bufnr from result dict right ?

comment_regular_data.body:
Somewhat related: `cmdline` flag discussed in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31269#discussion_r1880449995 .

But in this case, `preview_winid` is a return value giving information about placement, whereas in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31269#discussion_r1880449995 , `cmdline` is used to control/decide a window.

Looks like these fields were added for `nvim__complete_set` https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/e38027ef69f75653ee953b16ebf4a8652a3fb748 , that would have been useful to mention the PR description.

The interface of `nvim__complete_set` is still pretty strange and needs more thought.

Are these fields related to `:help preview-window` and `:help 'previewpopup'`? It seems like we should implement 'previewpopup' (after this PR) before continuing to develop this interface--or explain why not.

The help doc for `nvim__complete_set` doesn't mention `preview_bufnr` / `preview_winid` at all, nor does it link to `complete_info()` where the fields are documented. Let's do that here. Then we can merge this since the fields already exist... but this interface really needs attention and thought.

> The interface of nvim__complete_set is still pretty strange and needs more thought.

After I finish the other completion work..I will rethink this and provide a PR in the hope that you can give more guidance where to go.

> Are these fields related to :help preview-window and :help 'previewpopup'? It seems like we should implement 'previewpopup' (after this PR) before continuing to develop this interface--or explain why not.

Different. vim uses completepopup(i impleent in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/25541) to set the maximum height and width of info popup. Lack of adaptivity. vim uses popup_findinfo function to get info popup winid/bufnr and use it with CompleteChanged. I add fields to complete_info here because our float interface lacks design compatibility with vim's popup. about previewpopup (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/26799)  our current focus is not on these. So these PRs have been put on hold.

> Different. vim uses completepopup(

Reading Vim's help I see that both 'previewpopup' and 'completepopup' exist. 

Why are the fields in this PR called `preview_winid` and `preview_winid` if they aren't related to the previewpopup/previewwindow?
Let's focus on this PR and complete it while we have the context in our heads...

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(eval): add preview window relate argument in complete_info
